Definition: In this task, you will be given sentences in which you have to recognize the name of the body cells. A cell is a mass of cytoplasm that is bound externally by a cell membrane. Usually microscopic in size, cells are the smallest structural units of living matter and compose all living things. Although there might be several correct answers, you need to write one of them.

Positive Examples.input: HeLa cells were first treated with 250 mug / ml Trail followed by pulse labeling of newly synthesized proteins with [ 35S ] methionine.
Positive Examples.explanation: HeLa cells are the first immortal human cell line. It should be tagged.

Positive Examples.input: Antisperm antibodies were assessed in the serum samples of 73 men unable to ejaculate naturally and on the sperm cells of 13 of these men .
Positive Examples.explanation: Sperm is a male reproductive cell, produced by most animals, hence needs to be identified.

Negative Examples.input: On pathologic examination of the specimen , typical large tumor cells with lymphocytic cell infiltration and prominent granulomatous reaction were observed .
Negative Examples.explanation: Detailed description of the tumor cells are irrelvant and should not be included.

Negative Examples.input: Antisperm antibodies were assessed in the serum samples of 73 men unable to ejaculate naturally and on the sperm cells of 13 of these men .
Negative Examples.output: sperm cells of 13 of these men
Negative Examples.explanation: Organisms containing the cells are not required and should be excluded.

To assess the changes in the oxidative capacity of neutrophils after the burn , blood samples for the Phagoburst analysis were taken on admission and at least once every second week for the duration of stay in hospital and thereafter monthly up to 12 months after the burn .

This study provides evidence that immunosuppression in those injured by burns , as assessed by the in vitro oxidative burst of neutrophils , remains long after the event of the burn ( up to 3 . 5 months after burn ) .
